channel.title: the fishman diaries
channel.description: Recent content on the fishman diaries

item.title: Data science and the occult
item.description: Disclaimer: This title is click-bait. I have read very little data science content over the Christmas period.

item.title: The whole thing starts with a box
item.description: Post of the Week As 2019 is coming to an end we can expect to see plenty of ‘best of the year’ type posts but the one I’ve enjoyed the most so far is re•work’s 30 influential videos of 2019.

item.title: Yippie kayak, other buckets!
item.description: Post of the Week The Information Commisssioner’s Office and The Alan Turing Institute are teaming up to publish their first draft of guidance into the use of ‘AI’.

item.title: A New Hope
item.description: Who’s more foolish? The fool or the fool who follows him?

item.title: Party all the time
item.description: Time is limited this week, so expect a rushed description of the content, but it is still better than no content!

item.title: Cordyceps
item.description: There are a million ways we should’ve died before today, and a million ways we can die before tomorrow.

item.title: The fast and the furious
item.description: Hobbs & Shaw wasn’t actually that bad… Post of the week This week has been spent mostly reading mathematics (which I won’t bore you with) so my post of the week is the light summary of OpenAI releasing that they said was too dangerous.

item.title: One more revolution, my love
item.description: One more revolution, my love One more time through the fire

item.title: Once upon a midnight dreary
item.description: Blessings to you and your beloved dead, on this night when the veil is thin and there is magick in the air.

item.title: Salvation is a last-minute business, boy
item.description: There is something haunting in the light of the moon; it has all the dispassionateness of a disembodied soul, and something of its inconceivable mystery.
